intro: Carpotroche parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved carpotroche, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
